meanings.definition: The ability to perceive depth using both eyes.
meanings.sent1: With his stereopses, he could easily tell how far away objects were.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use stereopses to understand how our eyes work together to see depth.
meanings.sent3: The detective's stereopses helped him spot the hidden clue in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her stereopses allowed her to see through the optical illusion and perceive reality.
meanings.sent5: The artist used stereopses to create a lifelike painting with depth and dimension.

meanings.sent1: The 3D movie relied on stereopses to make the images pop out of the screen.
meanings.sent2: Virtual reality technology uses stereopses to immerse users in a realistic environment.
meanings.sent3: The magic show used stereopses to make it seem like objects were floating in mid-air.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting used stereopses to trick the eye into seeing depth on a flat canvas.
